Exittent.D1: Nothing like morning air to get the blood pumping! What a great morning for a hunt!
Exittent.D2: I wonder what the rest are up to...

Grave.D1: The stone reads "She who remembers the sacred places, the bodies of water, the origin.
Grave.D5: Coznac definitely needs your guidance now..

leavearea1.D1: I better talk to Ruslan first, he looks like he wants to talk to me.

Ruslan.D1: Ah, good morning, Gulnaz. You're up early.
Ruslan.D3: Mornin' Ruslan. I guess I'm just excited to get my dagger back from the smith!
Ruslan.D4: Going out for a hunt seems to be the only thing that can take my mind off what has been going on lately...
Ruslan.D5: It is quite the predicament. Our tribe is in disarray, and instrumental magic isn't helping.
Ruslan.D6: I'm not a fan either... Can't you do something about it- being the Spirit Counselor and all?
Ruslan.D7: You know how it is with Aibek and I... He's obstinate. Only your grandma could ever get to him, spirits bless her.
Ruslan.D10: The spirits in this area, I can sense their malaise.
Ruslan.D11: We've been in this area for far too long.
Ruslan.D12: Magic may be sustaining us, but I fear that staying any longer might bring a blight.
Ruslan.D13: Not on my watch it's not.
Ruslan.D14: Hahaha... You've always displayed the same fiery ardour as your precursors.
Ruslan.D17: Could you perhaps pass this letter to Inzhu? I need her to give it to Aibek.
Ruslan.D18: A letter for the chieftain? Uh, sure, I can do that.

Ruslan2.D1: I think I saw Serik up ahead. Why don't you chat with him instead?

Serik.D2: Uh, hey, muscle brain. Also- I like all animals equally. Not just birds.
Serik.D3: Uh-huh. So what're you up to?
Serik.D5: Well, that's better than participating in his magic classes.
Serik.D6: Oh spirits, I rather clean the stables for a month than attend ONE class.
Serik.D7: You are such a drama queen.
Serik.D9: Anyways, I have to get back to my chores.
Serik.D10: Sure you don't need any of my muscly assistance?

Serik3.D1: Boy. I wish I had a AAA sandwich.

enterarea4.D2: I should hand over the letter to her.

Inzhu.D1: Well, well! If it isn't the lass herself! How goes the hunting?
Inzhu.D3: Maybe you should take up magic instead? It's surely much more effective than swinging a piece of metal around.
Inzhu.D4: NO way! I'm a beast with a sword.
Inzhu.D5: Plus, I'm not on board with the magic thing. It's shady, it's direspectful, and it's too good to be true.
Inzhu.D6: Hum, suit yourself. If you change your mind, Aibek's conducting lessons up ahead.
Inzhu.D7: We've got a bunch of carcasses for the instruments from the last hunt.
Inzhu.D9: Say what you will about Aibek, Gulnaz, but he is the Chieftan. People trust him, as I do.
Inzhu.D10: Speaking of... Ruslan wanted this letter delivered to Aibek. Here.
Inzhu.D11: What's this, I'm a middle man now?
Inzhu.D12: Anyway, Temir said she was looking for you. Why don't you go get your sword? She's at her hut to your right.
Inzhu.D13: Thanks. Let's debate the good of magic some other time.

inzhucockblock.D1: Woah! Where do you think you're going? Temirs' hut is off to the right.

Inzhu2.D1: Don't you have a piece of metal to swing around?
Inzhu2.D2: Don't you have a magic spell to fail?

Temir.D6: Give it a swing on those dummies over there, why don't you?

Temirhashadit.D1: Woah, easy on the dummies, Gulnaz.
Temirhashadit.D3: Don't make me craft the dummies again.

Inzhucockblocksagain.D1: Uh, are you gonna help out your bestie over there or what?

Serik4.D2: Those haystacks look pretty heavy, Serik.

Serik5.D1: Wow! Do those even weigh a thing to you?
Serik5.D3: Well, I'm going uphill to report to my dad. Do you wanna come with?
Serik5.D4: Sure, I've got some time to kill.

enter1-1.D1: I know you don't go out often, but what exactly are you gawking at?
enter1-1.D2: It's nothing! I just haven't been this far from the tribe before...
enter1-1.D3: You've got to be kidding, right?
enter1-1.D4: Is your sword alone really going to keep us safe from... whatever's out there?
enter1-1.D5: Oh, you HAVE to be kidding.
enter1-1.D6: I just lost my body, so really, I'm not very keen on losing any more of my livilhood. You know. Like dying?
enter1-1.D7: Listen to me, Serik. All my life, I've been gathering and hunting for game.
enter1-1.D8: I know everything there is to survive, and I know this place like the back of my hand!
Since we've been here for so long. Thanks to your oh-so-great dad.

desh1-1.D2: What! What is it!! Is it Bearguar?!!
desh1-1.D6: Keep it down! I don't know what it is, but if it's hostile, I'm ready.

defeated1-1.D3: Well, I don't doubt that we're still susceptible to death.

shoes21-1.D3: Serik, hold up! Spirits damn it!

pig1-1.D4: Okay. You don't want to upset me piggy.
pig1-1.D6: Spirits, shut up! You sound just like-

posession1-1.D1: Ah! I think? I may have just possessed that Lavapig??
posession1-1.D3: I.. I think I can do it again!
posession1-1.D5: I don't know! Is this ability not potentially useful?
posession1-1.D6: I need a moment to register..this whole thing.
posession1-1.D7: Well, I'm gonna give this another go.

seriksapig1-1.D3: I... I'm still trying to register this..
seriksapig1-1.D4: But...that fiery sneeze seems very helpful.. Hehehehe.
seriksapig1-1.D5: Uh. I don't like that look you're giving me, Gulnaz..
seriksapig1-1.D6: I wonder what other creatures I can possess.

secndgate1-1.D2: Coznac's security team is at it again.. There's probably a funny mechanism behind this.
secndgate1-1.D3: Something looks different about this gate.
secndgate1-1.D5: Those bowls are pretty high up, so the Lava Pig probably can't do anything with it.
secndgate1-1.D6: Hey, maybe we can find some kind of long stick or something. Let's take a look around.

dontidiot.D1: I know you just took on 3 of these guys, but aren't you getting a little cocky?
dontidiot.D3: I could totally take these losers.
dontidiot.D4: No..! There's gotta be a smarter way around this.

dontidiot2.D4: I don't know. Trying to stab them?
dontidiot2.D5: No, there's surely a better solution..

dontidiot3.D2: Ahhhh... Serik you don't have to yell...
dontidiot3.D3: Then stop walking towards those things!
dontidiot3.D4: Okay, yeah, there's a better solution yadda yadda.
dontidiot3.D6: Let's check out those logs. I think they're worth investigating.

dontidiot4.D2: Right, right... Please stop glaring at me like that. It's weirding me out.
dontidiot4.D4: Stop flaring your nostrils at me, I'll figure it out. The logs, right?

firstarchuraencounter.D2: What's this? You caught up with me?
firstarchuraencounter.D3: Interesting! How did you even get by all the cute little Desh?
firstarchuraencounter.D5: Oh. That was a little underwhelming.
firstarchuraencounter.D6: Well it's getting late, kids. Shouldn't you be heading back?
firstarchuraencounter.D7: Not until you give me back my body and explain your actions, you-
firstarchuraencounter.D8: This is boring. I'm outta here.
firstarchuraencounter.D11: Stop staring and start flying, bird-boy!

one2start.D5: Okay bird-boy, let's get moving then.

Archuraencounter.D1: Okay, okay... We've got you now, fiend!
Archuraencounter.D2: Serik's practically an expert at possessing creatures now!
Archuraencounter.D4: No!! You're amazing! Now let's kick his butt!
Archuraencounter.D5: THAT'S MY BUTT! We're talking about my body here!
And...it's all dirty... and caked in mud.
Archuraencounter.D8: You kids done with your talking yet?
Archuraencounter.D9: You've got an interesting ability there, boy.
Archuraencounter.D10: You can thank me for that!
Archuraencounter.D13: Give Serik his body back, you body-stealing thief!
Archuraencounter.D15: It's been fun watching you guys tail after me, but...
Archuraencounter.D16: If you value your life, you should turn back now.
Archuraencounter.D17: Also you get a neat party trick out of this!
Archuraencounter.D18: I say you go back home to your disgusting tribe and continue brandishing your devilry.

end1-2.D1: How does he even.. bolt off like that.
end1-2.D2: It's very odd seeing... you being so athletic.
end1-2.D3: Thanks. You always know how to flatter me.
end1-2.D4: I should take you hunting with me sometime.
end1-2.D5: If I get my body back...
end1-2.D7: Of course we're getting your body back!!!
end1-2.D10: We'll get your body back- I promise!

archura2-1.D1: Weh? You did exactly what I said not to do!
archura2-1.D2: I'll take you on, right here, right now!
archura2-1.D3: Maybe we should talk it out...
archura2-1.D4: Oh Serik, you're always one for diplomacy... But some things just have to involve some stabbing.
archura2-1.D7: What did you mean when you said Coznac was disgusting?
archura2-1.D9: Ugh... No creature should be put through such despicable rituals...
archura2-1.D10: Ew, don't remind me, I might just vomit.
archura2-1.D11: If you find it disgusting why do you practice it?
archura2-1.D12: We don't! We're totally against it!
archura2-1.D13: A good half of Coznac is...
archura2-1.D15: It doesn't matter. Suzy and Gary are gonna pulverize you anyway.
archura2-1.D16: Uh. Let's just continue tailing him.

endof2-1.D1: That..that must have been the fabled Suzy and Gary.
endof2-1.D2: I'm just glad we didn't get 'pulverzied'.
endof2-1.D3: Seriously, this is starting to get really dangerous.
endof2-1.D4: Are you wussing out on me?
endof2-1.D8: Haha.. You didn't think so days ago.
endof2-1.D9: That was days ago. So much has happened since.
endof2-1.D10: My doubt in us is clearly misplaced.
